result.execSummary:
The defendant Karl J. Landt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
** Pay fine of $1000.00 (each count)  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  each count.  May Not have contact with any minors, co-defendant or any victims who have been and can be identified without permission of the agent.  Not to possess or use a computer. Participate in a mental health evaluation.  No possession of electronic devies capable of accessing the internet.  No possession of devices enabled to record visual images or auditory records.  Register as a sex offender for 15 years after the completion of the sentence.  Participate with Sex Offender treatment.  Participate in the creation of a realistic case plan and any programming related to the associated goals and identified Criminogenic Nees.

Post Conviction Motion - 10/12/17

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Hannah Jurss.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  300 - Parties prepared to proceed.   Victim rights compliance.  DE moves to withdraw plea for manifest injustice citing Bangert violation.  ST does not feel the DE has met their burden. Discussion held. Court finds no deficiency on the part of the Court at the time of sentencing. Motion is denied without evidentiary hearing. Motion for sentence modification heard. Discussion held. Court finds no new factors have been presented. Motion to modify sentence denied. Atty Jurss to prepare an order consistent with today's findings.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on October 12, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. DE appears by Atty Jonathan Smith - by phone. Atty Jonathan Lavoy appears by phone for co-defendant, Melissa Wenckebach.     Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  Matter heard with 14CF529, 14CF1182. Hearing scheduled re: flash drives & digital photos provided to court. The court wishes to return said items to the DA's office, as they were never offered as evidence in the cases. No objection from ST or Atty Lavoy. Atty Smith reports DE has filed for post-conviction relief with Atty Hannah Schieber Jurss.  Atty Hannah Jurss now appears by phone. Atty Jurss has not had the sufficient time to review the files, and therefore requests the items be kept available for her review through the DA's office, should she need them. Atty Smith offers his copies of the items to Atty Jurss.  ADA Graveley has no objection to the proposed exchange. Atty Jurss requests items be kept through the end of March 2016. Granted. Digital item turned over to ADA Graveley this day.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley & Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person & w/ Attorney Jonathan Smith & Attorney Susan Roth.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:55am-  Matter heard with 14CF529 & 14CF1182.  Victim rights compliance - victims are present.  Court orders media outlets to not take any videos of the victims that choose to make statements.  Audio recordings are allowed.  List of victims that will be providing a statement at today's hearing will be sealed in the court file.  Attorney Smith requests the psychological reports filed on 9/15/2015 be sealed.  State takes no position.  Court denies request for reasons set forth on the record.  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 3 years:  1 year initial confinement & 2 years extended supervision on each count consecutive.  Credit for 21 days.  Court orders $1,000.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge on each count - bond on deposit to be applied.  Remaining balance to be returned to poster.  DE is not eligible for CIP or SAP.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  DE to register as a sex offender up 15 years after the completion of the sentence.  Appeal rights given.  DE TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.  Copy of certified minutes given to deputy.

Defendant, Karl J. Landt, appeared with Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith.  Attorneys Michael David Graveley and Carli McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Atty Smith indicates his contractual issues with DE have been resolved and he should remain as attorney of record. ST has filed a motion to consolidate 14CF406, 14CF529, and 14CF1182 and they should be tried by jury at the same time; DE does not object; so ordered. Bond continued.
No action taken this day.

Defendant, Karl J. Landt, appeared with Attorney Jonathan Carver Smith. Attorneys Michael Graveley and Carli McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Discussion held on Atty Smith's motion to withdraw; ST opposes any action that would adjourn the trial date; The Court grants Atty Smith's motion to withdraw. Bail assignment filed in court; Atty Smith requests to withdraw the Bail Assignment; The Court takes no action on the Bail Assignment today as the bond poster is not in court. Motion Hearing on 03-20-15 at 10:00 am remains on the calendar.
Motion hearing on March 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
to withdraw - filed by Atty Jonathan Smith

Attorney Michael Graveley & Attorney Carli McNeil appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Jonathan Lavoy.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:25pm-  Matter heard with co-defendant's case, 14CF529 & 14CF1182.  Victim rights compliance.  On the Court's own motion, Court severs this case from the co-defendant's case.  DE is requesting matter be set for trial.  State intends on filing a motion for joinder of the DE's cases.  Court orders the motion to be filed by 2/9/2015;  DE to respond by 3/6/2015;  State to reply by 3/13/2015.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Court sets matter for trial.  Court orders all witness lists & motions in limine be filed by 4/30/2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.

14CF406, 14CF529 & 14CF1182 - Attorneys Michael Graveley and Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Jonathan C. Smith.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  State has put their offer to resolve all cases in writing; def. has until 1/5/15 to accept or reject the offer.  FPT 1/8/15 at 2:00.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Jonathan C. Smith.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  After discussion, Court permits Kenosha News to take still and video during this hearing.  Pretrial adj. to 10/30/14 at 3:00 to allow counsel to review discovery.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on September 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
